attributes.comment:
The existence of a directory of healthcare providers and services would be very beneficial to patients and those who move through the healthcare system looking for treatment. From a consumer perspective, having one that is updated and accurate so I can find medical treatment without the "filter" of those my insurance covers would be a huge step forward. People need to find support and services, sometimes urgently, and a single location to find those resources would be very empowering to me.

On the flip side, I've heard from various doctors and providers that they don't want their phone numbers and email addresses available to the general population, and will fight this. But I ask, why practice medicine if you don't want people to call you and email you to see if you can help them?

The key to success, from a consumer and patient perspective, in my opinion will be the accuracy of the information maintained in this directory. Will it show correct phone numbers, new physician practices/provider settings, changes to existing practices/settings, and help a person connect with the professionals listed? Ideally, someone like me would use DIRECT or another secure mechanism to send my medical records to the provider I'm seeing so that my information is available to them even if interoperability across healthcare isn't robust. That is what will be important to success from a patient/consumer perspective, which may not be the same priorities as the providers listed in the directory will have.
